p: Both simulated and actual risk are the result of uncertainty, which is the lack of precision in knowing where in the “All possible” circle the final single real world realisation will lie. The “Simulated events” oval presents the model's attempt to capture exactly the underlying distribution of probabilities – i.e. the “All possible” area, usually through simulating multiple climate and socio-economic scenarios, bias correction of climate model output, crop model calibration, model ensembles and expert interpretation.
